member.name: T:Telnet.VirtualScreen
member.summary:
Implements a simple "screen". This is used by telnet.
The x (rows) and y (columns) values may have an offset. If the offset is 0/0 the left upper corner is [0,0], or 0-based. With an offset of 1/1 the left upper corner is [1,1], or 1-based.
member.remarks: The class is not thread safe (e.g. search in buffer and modification of buffer must not happen. It is duty of the calling class to guarantee this.

member.name: T:Telnet.Terminal
member.summary:
Supports telnet connectivity.
Version 0.70 1st running version
Version 0.71 Telnet class renamed to Terminal and close method improved
Version 0.72 Added custom exceptions which may be used externally Feedback of Mark H. considered, Wait() method added and WaitForChangedScreen() fixed
Version 0.73 Offset problem in Virtual Screen fixed due to mail of Steve, thanks!
Version 0.74 SendResponseFunctionKey(int) and fixed WaitFor[XYZ]-methods to better reflect the timeout. Thanks Judah!
Features Telnet functionality implemented
LOGOUT Logout functionaliy implemented
NAWS Sends a window size
TERMTYPE Sends an "ANSI"-terminal type
Other telnet commands Will be answered correctly with WILL / WONT
ESC-Sequences Method dealing with ESC-sequences
member.remarks:
The class is NOT thread safe for several connections, so each connection should have its own instance.
Credits for source code / technical information helping me:
Tyler Kline "clsScriptingTelnet" Internet page
Igor Moochnick "RemoteConsoleSolution" Internet page
http://invisible-island.net/xterm/ctlseqs/ctlseqs.html#PC-Style%20Function%20Keys http://code.google.com/p/mintty/wiki/Keycodes
http://www.networksorcery.com/enp/protocol/Terminal.htm
http://members.tripod.com/~ilkerf/cdoc/vt100ref.html
http://www.klausbasan.de/misc/telnet/index.html

member.name: M:Telnet.Terminal.WaitForChangedScreen
member.summary: Wait for changed screen. Read further documentation on WaitForChangedScreen(int).

member.name: M:Telnet.Terminal.WaitForChangedScreen(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Waits for changed screen: This method here resets the flag of the virtual screen and afterwards waits for changes.
This means the method detects changes after the call of the method, NOT prior.
To reset the flag only use WaitForChangedScreen(0).
member.remarks: The property ChangedScreen of the virtual screen is reset after each call of Hardcopy(). It is also false directly after the initialization.

member.summary: Wait (=Sleep) for n seconds

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Allows for a single call to output text at a specific location and colors.
Output text value. Column value (0 based). Row value (0 based). Foreground color. Background color. 0=Success, other value failure.
[Cory Smith] 06/20/2003 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the console font.
member.value: A value of the ConsoleColor enum that specifies the color of the console font.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the console background.
member.value: A value of the ConsoleColor enum that specifies the color of the console background.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Echo
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the console must echo the input or not.
member.value: A boolean value that specifies the console must echo the input or not.
member.remarks: EchoInput is often turned off when the program asks the user to type in a password.

member.name: T:Win32.ConsoleEx.Colors
member.summary: Enumerates all available colors for the forecolor or the backcolor of the console.

member.name: T:Win32.ConsoleEx.ConsoleCursorInfo
member.summary: The CONSOLE_CURSOR_INFO structure contains information about the console cursor.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ConsoleCursorInfo.Size
member.summary: Specifies a number between 1 and 100, indicating the percentage of the character cell that is filled by the cursor. The cursor appearance varies, ranging from completely filling the cell to showing up as a horizontal line at the bottom of the cell.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ConsoleCursorInfo.Visible
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of the cursor. If the cursor is visible, this member is TRUE (nonzero).

member.name: T:Win32.ConsoleEx.Coord
member.summary: The COORD structure defines the coordinates of a character cell in a console screen buffer. The origin of the coordinate system (0,0) is at the top, left cell of the buffer.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.Coord.X
member.summary: Horizontal or column value.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.Coord.Y
member.summary: Vertical or row value.

member.name: T:Win32.ConsoleEx.SmallRectangle
member.summary: The SMALL_RECT structure defines the coordinates of the upper left and lower right corners of a rectangle.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.SmallRectangle.Left
member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.SmallRectangle.Top
member.summary: Specifies the y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.SmallRectangle.Right
member.summary: Specifies the x-coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.SmallRectangle.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies the y-coordinate of the lower right corner of the rectangle.

members.member: ' ' The ConsoleScreenBufferInfo structure contains information about a console screen buffer. '

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ScreenBufferInfo.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size, in character columns and rows, of the screen buffer.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ScreenBufferInfo.CursorPosition
member.summary: Specifies the column and row coordinates of the cursor in the screen buffer.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ScreenBufferInfo.Attributes
member.summary: Specifies the foreground (text) and background color attributes to be used for characters that are written to a screen buffer by the WriteFile and WriteConsole functions, or echoed to a screen buffer by the ReadFile and ReadConsole functions. The attribute values are some combination of the following values: FOREGROUND_BLUE, FOREGROUND_GREEN, FOREGROUND_RED, FOREGROUND_INTENSITY, BACKGROUND_BLUE, BACKGROUND_GREEN, BACKGROUND_RED, BACKGROUND_INTENSITY.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ScreenBufferInfo.Window
member.summary: Specifies a SMALL_RECT structure that contains the screen buffer coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the display window.

member.name: F:Win32.ConsoleEx.ScreenBufferInfo.MaximumWindowSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size of the console window, given the current screen buffer size and font and the screen size.

member.name: M:Win32.ConsoleEx.Cursor.ChangeCursor
member.summary: Applies the current cursor settings.
member.remarks: This method applies changes in the CursorVisible and OvrMode properties.

member.name: M:Win32.ConsoleEx.Cursor.Move(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the cursor to the specified location.
member.param: Specifies the x value of the new location.
Specifies the y value of the new location.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Cursor.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cursor is visible or not.
member.value: A boolean value that specifies the visibility of the cursor.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Cursor.OverwriteMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cursor is in overwrite-mode or not.
member.value: A boolean value that specifies the mode of the cursor.
member.remarks: In overwrite mode, the cursor size will be 50% of the character space instead of 25% in normal mode

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Cursor.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the current cursos position on the x axis in the console.
member.value: A value that specifies the current cursos position on the x axis in the console.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Cursor.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the current cursos position on the y axis in the console.
member.value: A value that specifies the current cursos position on the y axis in the console.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Window.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the caption of the console.
member.value: A String that specifies the caption of the console.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Window.Width
member.summary: Gets the width (in characters) of the console window.
member.value: An integer that holds the width of the console window in characters.

member.name: P:Win32.ConsoleEx.Window.Height
member.summary: Gets the height (in characters) of the console window.
member.value: An integer that holds the height of the console window in characters.
